input: By the end of this post you’ll be able to build your first AI agent
writing_steps:
Step 1: Purpose is to educate and provide a clear path to first-time agent builders, validating Shaw’s teaching approach. Target audience: aspiring AI solopreneurs, developers new to agents, and his existing audience interested in hands-on action.

Step 2: Wireframe
- Hook: You’ll be able to build your first AI agent after reading this post
- Meat: Lay out the exact blueprint and simplest way to get started
- CTA: Call for readers to try it and share what they’ll build/ask follow-up questions

Step 3: Meat
Building an AI agent sounds intimidating. But if you break it down, it’s just three basic steps:

1. ✅ Pick a simple tool (like LangChain, CrewAI, or OpenAI Assistants API)
2. 🏗️ Define the task you want your agent to do (e.g., summarize documents, draft emails, answer FAQs)
3. 🧩 Connect the dots: feed your tool a prompt, set up input/output, and hit ‘run’

You don’t need deep ML knowledge. Try building an agent that answers questions about a PDF or generates daily summaries from your calendar. Start tiny. Once it works, you’ll see how fast you can build real, useful workflows.

Step 4: CTA
What’s the first task you’d automate with your own AI agent?

Step 5A: Brainstorm hooks
- [Promise/outcome] “Build your first AI agent today—no experience required”
- [Problem/solution] “Think AI agents are scary? Here’s the 3-step beginner blueprint”
- [Personal story] “My first AI agent was embarrassingly simple—and yours should be too”

Step 5B: Short notes
- [Promise] Emphasize literally building
- [Problem] Highlight simplicity/‘anyone can do it’
- [Personal] Make it relatable and encourage ‘start small’

Step 5C: Pick best direction and write hook
I’ll pick the [Promise/outcome]:

"By the end of this post, you’ll be able to build your first AI agent—even if you’ve never touched code before."

Step 6: Review for Shaw's style: approachable, clear, actionable, friendly. White space and checkmarks for clarity.

Step 7: Final post below.
final_post:
By the end of this post, you’ll be able to build your first AI agent—even if you’ve never touched code before.

Here’s the 3-step beginner blueprint:

1. ✅ Pick one easy tool (LangChain, CrewAI, OpenAI Assistants API)
2. 🏗️ Decide on a single, useful task (summarize documents, answer FAQs, draft emails...keep it simple!)
3. 🧩 Plug your prompt into the tool, connect your input/output, and hit run

That’s it. Don’t over-engineer—start with something tiny and real. (My first agent just sent me morning reminders!)

The first time it works, you’ll realize: you can automate real work. And it’s not magic—it’s just building blocks.

What’s the first task you’d automate with your own AI agent?
